replies.body: And now you have to disenchant for 20% value. It bugs my OCD.
Why, tho? I mean reducing the disenchant value was still dumb despite "muh more champ sharz", but If anything's positive about it is that 33% nearly always creates such ugly numbers.
I hate having to chase after levels just to get a reward.
Don't mean to be a dick, but strange to hear that from someone with the BE-bait icon. That shop was made specifically to bait people into drowning themself into this system.

> Don't mean to be a dick, but strange to hear that from someone with the BE-bait icon. That shop was made specifically to bait people into drowning themself into this system.

I have plenty of surplus BE for now because I had a lot of IP before the change, so I didn't mind buying one to see what I got (Taric, yay).

I have concerns going forward with how I'll be able to keep up with champ releases and BE accumulation vs the old system.
Old system I could make at least 6300ip to afford the new champion by the time they released. I don't know if I'll be able to level fast enough to afford them with the new system, and I refuse to spend RP on champions. RP is for costmetics.
1-4 days to level up, 910 BE per level on average, so 7 levels to hit 6300, or 4 weeks of consistent play, at the most. 5 weeks, if you want them on release during the 7800 price range.
vs being able to farm 6300 in two weeks at only a few games a day
That required 4-5 games each day. Playing the same amount in the new system levels you every other day, so you get 6300 in 2 weeks, as well.

With just your first win of the day, you were getting an average of 272 ip for a 35 minute game, one game a day is then 3808 IP in 2 weeks.  A lose for a 35 minute game averaged a little over 85 ip, so playing two games a day, winning one, and losing one you'd get 5000 IP in two weeks.  Adding in just 1 more lose a day gets you to 6192.

So even going with an abysmal 33% winrate you'd get 6300 averaging 3 games a week, plus 1 additional win. It would take ~52 games, assuming you only won 15.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Influence_Points

Here is the exact formula for IP gains.

> Wins: Approximately 18 IP + 2.312 IP per minute.
> Losses: Approximately 16 IP + 1.405 IP per minute.

A 35 minute game gives you 99 IP for a win and 65 for a loss, not 122 and 85. Playing 3 games a day with 33% winrate gives you 6300 IP after 17 days and 50 games (your model gives 42 games, not 52).

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Experience_(summoner)

Here is the formula for XP gains.

> Wins: Approximately 5.767 base XP plus 6.626 XP per minute

Losses haven't been updated in the system, yet, but they appear to be ~50 less than wins at 35 minute game lengths.

A 35 minute game gives 238 XP, and we'll assume a loss gives 188, plus 575 for First Win. Playing 3 games a day with 33% winrate gives you the 7 levels to get 6300 BE in 17 days and 51 games (levels 31 and 32 both require 2500 XP to achieve, so 7 levels would take 17,500 XP - however, XP requirements will increase each level, so I added a generous 2500 to that for a high estimate of 20k XP for the 7 levels).

Oh, hey, look at that. It's almost exactly the same.

Yet, if you look at your own match history, (if you still have games far enough back where you can see) you'll notice that for loses its actually much closer to 17 + 2 per minute for a lose, and closer to 20 + 2.5 for wins.  I pulled those numbers from real games off my match history. 

Had a win at 34:58 that gave 122 IP (+150 for FWotD, and that's 272) and had a lose at 36:03 worth 87 IP.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/233830657

From top to bottom:

* 32 minute win for 92 IP

* 34 minute win for 96 IP + First Win

* 41 minute win for 113 IP + First Win

* 22 minute win for 76 IP

* 32 minute win for 92 IP + First Win

* 25 minute loss for 51 IP

* 28 minute win for 82 IP + First Win

* 38 minute loss for 69 IP

* 28 minute win for 82 IP

* 31 minute win for 89 IP

Actually, I'm not sure if you can see the IP gains if it isn't your own match history, so here's a screenshot:

https://i.imgflip.com/1z74vc.jpg

I'm not saying you're lying, but... When both the League Wiki's formula and my own match history show a completely different IP gain than what you're claiming... Got any evidence for those IP gains you're throwing around?

After 9 games, I got my champion capsule, which netted me 810 BE.

If this were the old system:
According to the League wiki, the IP you get is generally as follows:
Wins: 18 + 2.312 p/min
Loss: 16 + 1.405 p/min
Bot Win (Lvl. 30): 18 + 1.85 p/min
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Influence_Points

Those 9 games were composed of 2 ARAM games (one win, one loss), 2 Bot games with First Win of the Day active, 3 won games and 2 lost games

Game 1: Bots, 17:31 (49 IP + 150 IP FWotD = 199 IP)
Game 2: Draft, lost, 27:10 (54 IP)
Game 3: Draft, won, 34:06 (97 IP)
Game 4: Draft, lost, 23:11 (48 IP)
Game 5: Draft, won, 38:40 (106 IP)
Game 6: ARAM, won, 21:51 (66 IP)
Game 7: Bots, 19:28 (53 IP + 150 FWotD = 203 IP)
Game 8: ARAM, lost, 16:54 (38 IP)
Game 9: Draft, won, 32:55 (91 IP)

Totaling 902 IP. And I didn't round the times up for Game 6, 8 or 9. If I did, it would probably net me maybe 910 IP

So the new system gives you less IP/BE than the old system. Instead of grinding just enough to get a new champion, you might be a couple BE short of getting a champion you REALLY want and you'll be stuck 2-5 more days until you level up, and then you'll have an excess amount enough to buy 1 or 2 450 champions.

Combined with the old players complaining that a 975RP skin way back then is now worth 150K BE, and players complaining (including me) that games have become way more snowballing now, this is probably the worst update that League as a whole has been given, at least of what I've seen
